content.text:
# Robert Byng (16th-century MP)

Robert Byng (by 1530–1595) was the eldest son of John Byng of Wrotham and Agnes Spencer. He was twice elected to Parliament, representing Steyning in 1555 and Abingdon in 1559. The latter seat was probably gained through the influence of his first wife's stepfather Sir John Mason.
He married twice. His first wife, Frances Hill, was the daughter of Richared Hill of Hartley Wintney with whom he had three sons, including his heir George Byng. His second wife was Mary Maynard, with whom he had three sons and a daughter. One of them was the son [http://www.historyofparliamentonline.org/volume/1604-1629/member/byng-william-1586-1669 William Byng] (1586–1669), Captain of Deal Castle 1611–1642. Robert Byng died on 2 September 1595.
